This partnership was initiated by CSW and is funded by the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) to inventory, organize, preserve, and digitize more than eighty Mazer collections pertaining to lesbian and feminist activism and writings.

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: The National Lesbian Conference was the first and only of its kind, attempting to set a national lesbian activist agenda. The event took place in Atlanta, Georgia in 1991 and drew over 2,500 registered attendees. The gathering was comprised of one full day of caucuses, five plenaries, four mornings of anti-oppression training and slightly fewer than three hundred workshops.

The Conference became a concept after the American attendees at an international lesbian conference in 1986 felt that they had no unified voice due to a lack of national lesbian agenda. In 1988, a few American lesbians met in Washington D.C. to plan a national lesbian conference. Subsequently, planning meetings were held in North Carolina, Oregon, and Missouri. Meetings operated by modified consensus. Consensus and parity (defined as 50% lesbians of color, 20% disabled lesbians and 5% old lesbians) were of prime importance. The full steering committee, with over 100 seats to represent many different interest groups, was never fully seated. Although the ostensible goal of the conference was to decide collectively on a national lesbian agenda, the goal remained elusive. The conference became fertile ground for intra-organizational conversations about representation and the political process, but a fair amount of strife and dissent plagued much of the conversation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains pre-planning materials as well as a conference program and news coverage of The National Lesbian Conference, held at the civic center in Atlanta, Georgia in 1991.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Documents relating to the preparation for The National Lesbian Conference. This includes flyers for fundraising events, registration documents, volunteer information, press releases, proposed program schedules and drafts of conference materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Documents relating to events and programming concerned with ageism and aging lesbian organizations. This includes newsletters for organizations, correspondence, speech drafts, meeting agendas, flyers, and workshop materials for an anti-ageism workshop.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Newspaper articles and clippings covering The National Lesbian Conference. Primarily, the articles are from lesbian, feminist, and progressive periodicals like off our backs and Frontiers as well as local Atlanta news outlets. The articles discuss the events of the conference, the divisiveness it exposed and the broader lesbian movement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Information and materials from participating organizations and groups within The National Lesbian Conference. This includes flyers, brochures and pamphlets, essays, membership information and calendars.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Full program for The National Lesbian Conference.
